thread.title: Kerr improving, will be with Warriors on SoCal trip
thread.title_full: Kerr improving, will be with Warriors on SoCal trip

author:
Diamond Leung

dleung@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Kerr improving, will be with Warriors on SoCal trip
text:
Kerr improving, will be with Warriors on SoCal trip By Diamond Leung Posted: 10/15/2015 06:07:28 PM PDT Updated: 10/15/2015 06:07:29 PM PDT OAKLAND -- Warriors coach Steve Kerr has seen his condition improve and is expected to join the team in Southern California on its three-game preseason trip, according to interim head coach Luke Walton. 
"He wouldn't be coming down with us at all if he was still as bad as he was, so I think it shows signs of improvement," Walton said Thursday. "I don't think it means he'll be back within the next two days, but all you can ask for is that he keeps getting better." 
During his leave of absence for the past two weeks, Kerr had spent most of his time away from the team focusing on his rehabilitation after undergoing two offseason back surgeries. He said a spinal fluid leak was the cause of symptoms including headaches that continue to keep him from rejoining the team. 
The Warriors are scheduled to leave town Friday to play exhibitions against the Los Angeles Lakers in San Diego and Anaheim, with a contest in between against the Los Angeles Clippers at Staples Center. The Warriors' regular-season opener will come four days after the Warriors arrive home from the trip. 
"I don't how much he'll be involved in what we'll be doing as far as practice and games," Walton said of Kerr joining the preseason trip. For more on the Warriors, see the Inside the Warriors blog at www.ibabuzz.com/warriors . Follow Diamond Leung on Twitter at twitter.com/diamond83 . Advertisement
